abstract: An action that dismisses a window associated to a particular scene.
overview:
## Overview

Use the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/EnvironmentValues/dismissWindow] environment value to get the instance of this structure for a given [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Environment]. Then call the instance to dismiss a window. You call the instance directly because it defines a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/DismissWindowAction/callAsFunction(id:)] method that Swift calls when you call the instance.

For example, you can define a button that closes an auxiliary window:

If the window was opened with [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/EnvironmentValues/pushWindow], the original presenting will reappear when this action is performed.

items.description: Dismisses the window that’s associated with the specified identifier.
items.name: callAsFunction(id:)

items.description: Dismisses the window defined by the window group that is presenting the specified value type and that’s associated with the specified identifier.
items.name: callAsFunction(id:value:)

items.description: Dismisses the window defined by the window group that is presenting the specified value type.
items.name: callAsFunction(value:)

items.description: A window dismissal action stored in a view’s environment.
items.name: dismissWindow

items.description: An action that dismisses the current presentation.
items.name: dismiss

items.description: An action that dismisses a presentation.
items.name: DismissAction

title: DismissWindowAction
